user_review: 5 star for beautiful venue with live jazz music. Came during covid but they have a huge outdoor space within their walls. Food was expensive, but makes sense for this venue. Mushroom crepe i got was not all that, just normal, so the high price was not justified.

Love bringing out of town guests to Jardin Nelson during late Spring and throughout the entire Summer!  The outside garden is one of the best in the city!  Even if it's raining or a little chilly outside, they have you covered (literally) with the coolest reversed umbrellas and heat lamps.  The live jazz adds to the special ambiance!If you're a fan of French Onion Soup...then you must have a bowl at Jardin Nelson!  It is fantastic!  Other dishes that friends and family love are:  Strawberry Maple salad, Eggplant Parm, and the baby back ribs!Jardin Nelson is located in the heart of Old Montreal.  So either before or after your meal you can walk around amongst local vendors, pop into stores along the route.  Also, close to the water, so you're just a few minutes away from the giant Ferris wheel!

Heavy rain didn't stop Jardin Nelson from offering outdoor seating and live music under a huge canopy in one area and clear plastic ceiling in another- to protect folks from Mother Nature on our first 2016 long weekend Montréal trip. The outdoor terrace has different nooks- so depending where you're sitting, you'll get a different angle of the stage. We were slightly elevated and didn't mind that we weren't that close to the stage anyway. Despite its Old Montréal location, Jardin Nelson wasn't drowning with elbow-to-elbow tourists. To be honest, I was actually into Jardin's charming terrace more than anything. Service was pleasant and after driving 6 hours from NY, Jardin's lunch was good.

This is a great place to enjoy Montreal life at its best.  The live jazz music and open air eating along with very good and tasty food.  Can't get much better than this, just it's a little hard to get in as there's always a line.

Come for the ambience and the music, and don't come here for the food. I got here around 3:30 p.m. when a live jazz band was playing on a Monday. But unfortunately they wrapped up within minutes of me arriving. So don't come here between 3:30 p.m. and 7 p.m, during the dead period, when there is a break from the live jazz band.The garden courtyard is super cute with flower arrangements throughout the restaurant and sunny in decor.The food was very mediocre - borderline inedible. so I would recommend to stick with the french stables versus what I did. I ordered Le potage du jour, which is a Mexican soup with radish, hominy, and chicken. It was too sour, with too much lemon juice in the soup. Upon the recommendation of the waitress, I tried the crab cake with a side of salad. The crab cake lacked structure and was really mushy inside. The accompanying salad had fresh fruit but the salad leaves were bland and yellow around the edges.Also I had the lemonade with basil and it was too sweet. If I were to come back, I would probably stick to drinks or tried and true dishes like french onion soup or burger and fries.

What an overrated tourist trap. Wish I paid attention to other Yelpers who were right to say that Montreal has too many amazing culinary delights to waste your calories on a mediocre meal at Jardin Nelson.Let's start with the fun part--the live wait. There is ALWAYS a loooong line stretching halfway across the block. Expect to spend at least an hour. We waited around an hour and a half on a blisteringly hot Sunday afternoon. No shade to hide in. Grueling.The place is always packed, so expect suuuuper slow service. This was our last meal on our Montreal trip, so definitely spoiled the concluding impression. We were waiting on our waitress for half an hour each time we needed water, condiments, dessert, or check. Seriously super slow and bad service. Way understaffed. Need more people to man the quantity of guests. Wasted over three hours on a meal that shouldn't have taken more than an hour. Inside is pretty, but too casual and not pretty enough that would justify waiting for two hours in the scorching sun.Now to the food. Agree with other Yelpers who questioned if this place is known for crepes, shouldn't they be good. We ordered mushroom and saddle of rabbit. What a disappointment. I love crepes, cheese, mushrooms, and rabbit, so I was seriously blown away by how bad our dishes were. Completely bland and tasteless. I literally did not taste anything--just bland cheese and mushrooms and some stale meat. The crepe was like cardboard--completely tasteless.The spare ribs were good--falling off the bone. But the sweet sauce was too obviously chemically sweet and cheap tasting, so I was not a fan.The best part of our miserable meal was the dessert. We got Montreal's favorite pudding. Have to admit--that was solid. The simple cake was baked and drenched in super sweet maple syrup. What joy to eat hot caramel and cake with cold ice cream. Wish the portion of ice cream was bigger and more proportional to the portion of the cake. I'm a total sugarholic and can handle any amount of sugar. But please listen to my advice--share that portion. It might seem small, but you won't be able to get through it yourself. I felt a crazy sugar rush after a few first bites and by the time I got halfway, I was already crushing from an overwhelming amount of sweetness. It is sooo good, but definitely diabetes on a plate. Share that sumptuous goodness and your health and taste buds will thank you.The only saving grace of this establishment is of course the live 24/7 jazz music. We sat right next to the band and the singer and enjoyed classic hits like My Heart Will Go On, Hit the Road Jack, My Favorite Things, etc. Very soothing. Guess everyone thinks the same if the crowds are always busting the doors. Overall, this is not a place for impatient food lovers. Good to hang out and enjoy the music with some drinks, but not for a meal.

Furngully | Friendly | intimate Furngully: Overall the entire restaurant is extremely green. They have various levels and the combination reminded me of the animated movie Furngully from my childhood. It's all out doors but the various levels protects you from the rain. We know this because about 20-30 minutes of our brunch was during a torrencial downpour. But, we were all good and just waited it out with more wine. Friendly: The entire staff was extremely accommodating to our rowdy crew. We were 14 guys on a bachelor party trip but the staff was quick, courteous (even to 'THAT GUY') and provided great recommendations. Intimate: The rooftop terrace provides an intimate atmosphere. Even though it's a completely outdoors and the tables at first glance appear pretty close, you can have a conversation and not be involved in other's conversation. At the same time you know you are in a busy spot. Literally there was never an open table in the Resturant for the 2.5 hours we were there. Pro tip: go during the week Monday - Friday and make a reservation at 11:30 or 12. That place gets packed quickly because it's in a prime spot of town. The weekends doesn't take reservation and it's really hard to get in. Pro tip: get the chicken dish with various combinations of fruits/vegetables (I forgot the name). But it was the first ever colder chicken dish, I truly enjoyed and would not hesitate to get again.

Caution: tourist trap! Long wait times, slow service & mediocre food.Came here for dinner after reading the rave reviews.... what a disappointment. Our food included:Fried calamari: soggyPiri piri chicken crepe... meh. Not flavorful at allCharcuterie pizza: the meat was all burnt... pizza crust was chewy. The only saving grace was the wonderful live band that kept the spirits high. Overall: Montreal as much better equally priced spots to eat at... I'd say try them instead!

Such an amazing place to go at the old port! The atmospher is nice , especially with the birds, the singer was wow! And the FOOD IS AMAZING! what i find nice is that there is much space between the tables even if there is a lot of peopleIll come back that's for sure!!

I this was one of the few places we ate out at since we spent so much time at night in our hotel room, ordering in. The service was really friendly and professional. I was mostly impressed by the views, we dined outside and it was really lovely. The exterior of the building and the patio and courtyard are all really charming. I had the Pate chinois au canard, the duck confit was delicious. It was paired with a corn duo and mashed potatoes and served with beets and a fruit ketchup that I did not try as I'm not a big ketchup fan. We also shared the maple ice cream cup, which I liked and only had a couple bites of as I was really full at that point. It was a nice dessert choice as it wasn't as rich as my meal. I had to laugh at my dining companion's attempt at  making conversation in French, his Irish accent is pretty thick and he sounds a bit comical to me, but the people here were really nice.

I absolutely love this place and think it's a must do when traveling to Montreal, especially if the weather is nice. First off, how does one pass up sitting outside, listening to live jazz, and drinking a freshly squeezed (OJ) mimosa? It's quite delightful. The place is huge, with a large outdoor area on the first floor, as well as an indoor area and a front patio area, then there's also an upstairs with indoor and outdoor seating. Yes, it's a bit touristy, but I gather locals go here too. I know I sure would. The jazz was really good, very relaxing overall, I felt like I could have easily stayed all day. The mimosas were an excellent start to my Saturday. I wish they were a bit stronger, but the fresh OJ was clutch. For brunch we ordered the poached duck egg and the open-faced grilled cheese sandwich. I thought both were excellent. The grilled cheese tasted a bit like dessert with the blue cheese, dates, and a dash of maple syrup. Yum. Overall, they have a super extensive menu with tons of great options. There's a separate menu for brunch, with very reasonable pricing and the regular menu for lunch/dinner. Tons of drink options too. I'm very glad we got the chance to check this place out! Service was very good too!

Yelp let me down. This is a tourist trap with over priced and very mediocre food IMO.Based on the reviews and location decided to come here on a Friday evening (our last evening in Montreal) and the front of the house guided us to the back of the house to be seated. With a line of over 20 people, we got seated in about 15 mins (not bad) but this place is hugeeeee.After we were seated, it was a good 20 mins before we got our water. Being over-zealous we ordered the calamari, peri peri chicken crepe and the charcuterie pizza. Since I wanted to have a sangria, the only one they offer in a glass was $13.50 vs. a half pitcher for $18.50. I decided to pick the half pitcher of the Lychee sangria. Service was slow and inattentive. 10 mins for the sangria to come, and another 20 mins for the food. Luckily we were seated next to the Jazz band, who were entertaining - frankly the only saving grace.Sangria was ok - a little watered down and very sweet. The peri peri chicken crepe was flavorful but ended up being mushy towards the center, and felt like a quesadilla to me. The pizza was a little more than a personal pizza size with a lot of meat but it was burnt all over. It felt like it sat in the oven a few minutes too long. And I forgot the calamari - a little too much batter and fried too long. I couldn't tell if they were onion rings or calamari frankly. Maybe my taste buds were messed up.This was a wrong choice in my overall wonderful culinary experience in Montreal.

Jardin Nelson was overall an amazing experience when I came in the summer time. When exploring Old Montreal it's really easy to get sucked into all the tourist traps that line every street corner, but Jardin Nelson was no tourist trap! The ambiance was amazing. When I went there was live music playing, and the band and the singer were absolutely divine. The outside garden is beautiful and the music made it all that much more magical. The food was a good price, and everything we got was a generous portion and also super delicious. I got a pizza chocked full of pepperonis and meats. The sauce was rich and flavorful and the crust was crispy and bready. The lasagna was also rich and delicious!

We came here for lunch while walking in the Old port area. There were so many restaurants to choose from and decided to go with Jardin Nelson.The place looks small from outside but once you go inside there's a lot of space. They had live French jazz music going on when we walked in. We got seats pretty quick. We ordered the small red sangria along with the tex mex pizza and ceviche. The sangria was good and refreshing and plenty for 2 people. It wasnt sweet which was good as well.The ceviche was small and rather unremarkable. The tex mex pizza was good, somewhat spicy. Overall good experience. Would recommend coming here for the ambiance, drinks and live music.

The ambiance can simply not be beat here. In my opinion it is worth waiting in line for, and I love that they also do not try to force you to leave when you are finished eating. The food is a little bit overpriced but it is still very fresh and tasty. Considering you are also getting entertainment included I would pay the slightly higher price for sure. The service is outstanding. When seated we noticed another table that looked available that had a better view of the band. We asked our server if we could move there, even though we had already ordered drinks and he said no problem and helped us move everything over. So accommodating and helpful, very deserving of a 5 star review.

I know no one NEEDS my recommendation to visit Jardin Nelson, it has quite a reputation on its own. But, here's my 2 cents -I first visited here when we met a Montreal-resident for lunch. Clearly this is one of the 'places to eat' in Montreal. Two years later when we returned to the city, all I wanted to do was come back here!The restaurant is, of course, beautiful. The flowers adorn all parts of the restaurant and it's the kind of place you want to just sit and chill, especially when they have jazz. We are very much the eat-and-run kind of couple, but we easily spent a couple of hours here. And that's not because of long waits or slow service, we actually were seated and fed within an hour of joining the line. The main draw for me was the pouding chomeur. It's the only place I've ever had it and I fell in love. But everything else we ate was delicious too - the server suggested the seafood crepe and lobster salad, both things we would never have chosen on our own but thoroughly enjoyed. The cheese plate was also surprisingly good - it had just the right amount of cheese and the blue was especially yummy. What a lovely way to enjoy Montreal summer

Love this place! I make sure to visit every time I visit Montreal. Food is standard brunch food, but I think ppl come for the live jazz on a weekend morning. Sometimes you get a good crowd that interacts with the musicians, sometimes people are just focused on their meal :)

Yes this is touristy, but I'm a tourist! I have been here on most of my visits to Montreal, when I'm visiting in season. I like the vibe--sitting outside with live jazz and munching on crepes. I tend to come at off hours, so I've not had to wait, but if you're coming at prime time, be prepared to stand in line. Service is friendly and attentive, but don't expect a whole lot of detail on the menu--they recommend the same dishes almost every time. I like the chicken liver pate and the seafood crepe. My son ordered the lobster mac and cheese, which was surprisingly heavy with lobster. I usually skip dessert and wander around to another restaurant for that, as their dessert options are too maple-y for me. A nice, classically Old Montreal experience.

Incredible back patio full of floral and live jazz music. Upbeat daytime tempo on a sunny day! Went here on a very quick hour-long lunch during a walking tour break, so we were rushed. No worry, we ordered right away; drinks and apps. The bruschetta was a bunch of almost looking garlic bread and you scoop your own tomato mix. I thought it was alright, my gf loved it. Also got fish tacos which I'm always picky about. They were good, had a different texture which I liked but not insane. The 4/5 comes from the atmosphere and serving. Next time in MTL I will go back and spend a real meal there and I have no doubt it would be amazing!

Simplement magnifique! Sorry, not many occasions where I get to whip out the French. This is certainly one, and then some! Normally I would say avoid any restaurant located in a cities most touristy area. Tourist traps are very much real. Not to mention the fact that the menu seems to cater to pretty much...everyone. That's normally never a good sign, but despite breaking every rule in the book, Jardin Nelson hits it out the park. Located in the always busy old Montréal neighborhood, Jardin Nelson features among the most unique dining spaces you'll find. A multi level semi covered outdoor garden, with an elevated jazz band overlooking the dining area. Truly beautiful. And the food? Mostly French inspired, but also featuring pizza, sandwiches, crepe, pasta, seafood, and even poke. Yes it's sort of all over the place, but the quality can't be denied. Quiet honestly, it doesn't even matter what you order...it's all good. Come one, come all, chez Jardin Nelson. Good eats meets good tunes meets great setting. All this equates to one of the most unique dining experiences around.

So this place was great atmosphere and music. I enjoyed the place especially because it gives you Europeon vibe. The dessert was my favorite the food was okay and service was good but it took long to get our food.

TIP: go during non-peak you're to avoid a long wait time Although touristy, I heard many locals here enjoying the food as well. The serving staff were all very nice and bilingual. The restaurant is a creaperie , so i would recommend a crepe. My boyfriend and I both had them, and they were easily the best crepes of my life (the Nelsen and spicy chicken one). We also had an appetizer (Brie fondue) which came with grapes, pesto, and pine nuts. I would love to come here again for dessert, but frankly our bill was pricey enough for an appetizer, two crepes, a sangria, an iced cappuccino, and a hard cider. All were amazing and would 100% recommend to anyone in the old Montreal area. :) see you next time!

expect the unexpected here. I didn't read any reviews before coming, just saw the stars and decided to drop by at an odd hour (no line up).I was greeted by a greeter that asked me where I wanted to sit; front or bank. I replied with 'I want to sit inside' since I thought there was a bit of miscommunication and I was wrong. On the other side of the brick store front was an outdoor seating area with big umbrella tents. It looked like something out of a fairy tail and to add to the ambiance, they had live jazz music that reminds you of a speakeasy Disney sound track. I would go there just for coffee. I ordered beef tartare and French onion soup. Huge portions and bang for your buck (they don't even charge for extra bread). Way too much for 2ppl who were looking to snack. I don't eat cheese but if I did I would love the French onion soup, the cheese was crisp on top of a slice of bread that soaked up the soup. It created a beautiful cheese pull, I was waiting for my bf to finish the cheese but man there was just so much cheese beyond the surface! If you're not tight on time, I would spend some time here and enjoy what they have to offer.

This restaurant was a huge disappointment. My sister and I waited 30 min in line because we heard it was worth it, then another 30 min at our table to get the 2 chocolate banana crepes we ordered. The atmosphere is nice if you like jazz. Otherwise, it's too loud and cramped. The crepes were pretty terrible and so far from authentic, I would never order there again. They were a bit over cooked, too thick, and the chocolate tasted like syrup from a bottle. There are also only 4 dessert crepe options to choose from. I wish we didn't come here for our Montreal crepe experience.

I love jazz and I love dinning at restos with live jazz performance!  Jardin Nelson is located in the lovely old Montreal with daily jazz performances. What's really amazing is that all of the walls are the originals from the 1800's!  Being in a garden setting with live jazz and a pitcher of sangria, the dinning experience was so awesome that who cares if the food is good or not!  All joke aside, the food wasn't bad either. Between the 4 of us, we ordered the calamari, chicken wings, French onion soup, cannoli, lobster roll, lobster Mac and cheese and aubergine au gratin. The only 2 dishes that made the cut was the French onion soup and baked cannoli.  The other dishes were just ok. The prices was fair taking into account the entertainment you get.  One word of advice, either come really early or later because the dinner rush line up is really long. The first time we came here, we were told 1hr+ wait, we came back the second night around 8pm and waited for 30mins.  The wait is worth it people!

Beautiful garden and atmosphere right in old Montreal. We had a pitcher of lychee sangria and their crepes (seafood was good but too rich, the beef was low pot pie, mushroom Brie wheat was ok, Banana chocolate was regular). We will skip crepes next time although they are known for it, not missing much. Live jazz band was amazing - I got their business card. Line up for table was short too even though it was packed. Will definitely visit again - will try other food items next time.

Poke and "tex-mex pizza" in a French restaurant? Is this real life?This place drips tourist, with the menu and location to fit. However, if you stick to the basics, you should be fine.I first came here years ago and the French onion soup was venerable. However, my recent visit, I went for the forestiere crepe. The crepe itself was fine. The crepe had a bit of crisp to it, while the filling inside was rich and flavorful. There was an abundance of brie and savory mushrooms. The accompaniment that came with the crepe was that side salad you first think of when it comes to French cuisine: jicama salad. The salad was fine, but just a bit strange for a crepe.Service was relatively friendly and my server was nice, especially since I could speak elementary French. However, I had to cringe when the American next table spoke French-ish and ended with "por favor".3.5 but I'll notch it up to a 4.

So glad that we walked past Jardin Nelson and heard the music coming from the patio area! I knew immediately that we had to go there. There was live jazz playing which was super nice and gave the place a nice vibe. They even had speakers from the live performance hooked to the bathrooms so you can still hear the music. The patio area is outdoors but completely covered with these ginormous umbrellas. I loved it! They had flowers and plants everywhere and it was just such a nice spot to be to eat and relax. For food, I would 150% recommend the duck leg confit and salad! It was sooo flavorful and tender. We also got the beef tartare which was good but definitely not as memorable as the duck leg. We also got the poor man's pudding for dessert and it was a great way to end our meal. It kind of tasted like bread pudding but with a cornbread-y texture. It was warm and served with vanilla ice cream. Such a treat! I'll definitely be back here to listen to the jazz and eat the amazing duck the next time I'm in Montreal.

Hands down my absolutel favorite outdoor dining in all of Montreal, and I've been to Montreal over 150 times in my life.  I have easily gone to Jardin Nelson for half of all of my trips there.  From the wonderful jazz bands to the beautiful flower gardens to the delicious menu, wait staff is always pleasant, owner is really nice, very customer friendly and the food is absolutely delicious.  Good int he sun and the rain, because they extend huge rain umbrellas over the seating to make sure no one gets wet, and recycle the rainwater to water the hanging flower beds everywhere. SO many delicious dishes, but my fave has to be the lobster meat salad. Pastas are all delicious as well, the pizzas are different and great, even the ribs are delicious. Don't forget dessert, they are awesome! Truly an adults date destination, but good for the whole family as well.

So far very sweet place in old town, extremely touristy but nice food! Highly recommend the French Onion Soup, spare rib appetizers also tasty. really cool outdoor space but cool covering to keep the sun and rain off. Seems that they have Music each night and play everything  in a melow romantic Jazz standards and Beatles songs in a light tempo.Pricey but nice place and would reccomend if your first time as a great dinner experience.

I am so happy I finally dragged my husband to try this gem of a restaurant. The service was great! It was so hard to make up my mind because I wanted to order so many things. Eventually, settled on eggplant parmigiana and quattro fromage pizza. The eggplant parmigiana was delicious!! And the pizza was mouthwatering. Only drawback: portions were rather small. The sangria was quite refreshing! Next time, will order an appetizer to make up for the small portions of the main dishes. Definitely going back!

While walking about old Montreal, we can across this this place.We ordered naches w/cheese for apps, which was excellent. For entrees we ordered curry chicken crepe, mushroom creep,  and canalonne. It was pretty good.  We sat on the patio.  We could hear live music from the garden area and see street artist painting and vendors in the square. Good vibe.

Ordered me the croque monsieur with smoked duck. It was excellent but I'm not sure it really needed the duck. Grilled cheese on it's own is already amazing. The entree comes with a summer salad that is just as wonderful-- the fruits and dressing all go so well together with the veggies. Drank a strawberry smoothie to go with it on this warm day and it was super refreshing. Aside from the delicious food, the restaurant is beautifully decorated (as a garden like the name suggests). Perfect for a summer day and there was live musicians play music for us on the stage. My waitress was friendly and provided superb service.

We went here for dinner on two consecutive nights for the great crepes (both sweet and savory ones were amazing) and the graceful vibe. Sitting in the garden and enjoying the live music while dining was a pleasant experience. I had the maple crepe (with maple gelato and maple syrup) for the first time: it was certainly something that opens your eyes to the world of maple-manic. The 3-scoop maple gelato cup we had the next night was amazing as well! I also need to praise the seafood crepe - it was overloaded with lobster chunks, shrimps and squids and baked in an overtly delicious bechamel sauce. Oh la la how I Admire the French quartier! Service was slow but friendly. They were willing to speak English to tourists from the west coast (unlike the French) despite my willingness to practice my awful French ...It seemed a lot of locals also went here as a spot. (Not merely for tourists.Will definitely recommend if you have a sweet tooth and is looking for a Frenchy garden vibe in Montreal.

My favorite summer spot! Once every summer I will be at Jardin Nelson without a fail. I simply enjoy the view inside... you go inside but you are actually outside. It's beautiful terrace, trees all around. I also love how plants are waved up on the stone wall. The vibe is classy; the live jazz music is soothing and fine foot tapping. The service is very amiable and helpful. Even though the place is always super busy; I am impressed with the patient service The restaurant has amazing crepes and fine summer cocktails. It's a super busy restaurant; there is always a line up; but the wait is worth. It's a perfect place to enjoy lunch or dinner with friends. Best part is the location is that it is in the heart of beautiful old Montreal.I can't wait till next summer!

Very good food. The piri piri crepe is very enjoyable. I miss the old curry crepe, but life moves on. Enjoyable music. Light jazz mostly, we'll played. Nothing hard-core for a dinner crowd who probably wouldn't enjoy Coltrane burning in their faces. Anyway dessert was also excellent. I've eaten here a few times.in the past few years and I'm sure I'll return again.

Had brunch here during my trip to Montreal in July. The place is absolutely beautiful and 3 times the size I was expecting it to be.We enjoyed our brunch with some nice live jazz music.My niece is celiac and the waitress did everything she could to make sure my niece could enjoy a nice gluten free meal- which she did.

I came out here on Wednesday evening with my 14yo cousin to celebrate her Maid of Honour acceptance and it wasn't that bad but could be better. Food: it was good but it seems the primary specialty is crepes which, on a hot and sticky day, doesn't really work too well but it is a preference! Waitress: excellent! She was so sweet and really seemed to care. We ordered the salmon tartar to start and before I even asked for it brought us extra bread because she figured it wasn't enough on the plate. Very thoughtful 5/5. The only thing that too away from the good experience is that we had to wait extremely long to get our main course--I assume no fault of hers. Ambience: yassssssssss. Loved the ambience! It is just such a superb location! Centre of old port but yet in the back you really get a great experience with jazz music, lots of greenery, and well seated tables. All in short, you should definitely come here for drinks and the good vibes, but don't expect high-end cuisine.

Must try - Crepes, both main dish and dessert - especially the Piri Piri Crepe was very yummy .. French onion soup and Salmon Salad were good too.Friendly staffThe weather last night post Canada Day fireworks was fantastic as we sat outside in back patio .. Jazz live music .. What was not too like at this place :)
Lovely location and ambiance. The duck confit crepe was so uniquely delicious. I've never had anything like it.

The maple ice cream crepe. Just do it.Over a course of 5 days we came here twice, and finished our trip to Montreal with dessert crepes. The seafood crepe is pretty good, as well as the duck confit. Live jazz music is relaxing and the outdoor seating is welcoming.

In August my wife and I went on our honeymoon to Montreal, and while we were there we wanted to try somewhere a little different for a fancy dinner out. And when we told the woman at the front desk of our hotel what we were looking for. She immediately mentioned this place as being unique and a little different. And boy how was she right. This place is amazing. It's a bit of a touristy place I'm sure given that it's in old town on a road cars can't even travel on. And from the front it looks like just a nice little bistro. But when you actually walk in and see the large "outdoor" area with seating it's kind of mind boggling. It's almost like an MC Escher drawing with all the different tiers with tables and open sky above you shoved between a bunch of buildings. They do have these large umbrella like fixtures that can be used for sole coverage due to weather I'd guess and heaters on the walls surrounding. But for the most part you don't even notice they are there. Live jazz band playing on a stage on the far wall. It's like no place I've ever been or seen before. The food was delicious, and I'd normally go into that so much more. But trust me. The ambience alone on that terrace. It doesn't matter if you go there for a few drinks lunch or dinner. I'd make a return trip just for the hospitality we were given and the amazing jazz show on stage.

The family and I decided to take some out of town friends to Le Jardin Nelson for a late night dinner. Obviously, the garden was closed off- so we settled for their outdoor terrace. The view is nice for tourists but for locals it can get old. The service was quick and pleasant, our waitress knew her menu inside out.We ordered a Caesar salad, with two kinds of Pam sized pizza (veggie and a shrimp with dill-the second of the two was phenomenal), onion soup (well made), and apple strudel for dessert. This was probably the highlight of the evening (2 pieces of bread baked with aged cheddar, bourbon, maple syrup, roasted pecans , and a side of vanilla ice cream). I probably would've enjoyed my meal in the garden which really adds the essence of this restaurant but until then-this is another mediocre fancy restaurant in Montreal along with the many others.

On a recent trip to Montreal we stopped here for a late afternoon lunch. We had a plate of Quebec cheese and french onion soup. My companion had a martini and raved about how it was made with fresh raspberries. I enjoyed how it was shaken and poured at the table. The cheese was amazing and there was much bread and croutons (big crackery things) to go along with everything. There is an extensive wine menu. It is located on a plaza where there is lots to see and do and many people. There is a patio which we sat on both times we went here. There are heaters and we found it quite comfortable to sit on the patio in October.

Let me draw you a picture of Jardin Nelson. It's a warm beautiful sunny Sunday, the birds and chirping, you drive or take the metro to the Old Montreal, you're surrounded by its charming cobble stone streets and the cold grey stone buildings casting shadows along your way down to Jardin Nelson. You go in, there's probably a line. Thirty minutes later you're seated, with your friend or partner, and there's live Jazz playing. The music is not too loud, nor too hushed. There are birds flying in the inside garden with an open sky and you're surrounded by luscious greens. As for food, you are given a few options from salads to crepes to tartares to other meat dish such as duck or rabbit. Service is polite and never fussed, and the food comes out warm and tasty. It won't be the best food you'll have in Montreal, but I would come for the ambiance. Tldr: Jardin Nelson has great live jazz band playing in a quasi outside garden where the food served is good, not the best but quite tasty nonetheless.

The food here is out of this world. The vanilla ice cream with maple syrup over cake was the best desert I've had in my life. Great outdoor seating and ambiance. Nice prices as well. If you are visiting the city this area and restaurant are a must.

Amazing ambiance.  This is my new favorite place in Montreal and I would eat every meal here if I could.Thanks to yelp pictures, I opted for the lobster salad sandwich.  It was simple but so fresh and flavorful. The salad was meh, but ingredients were definitely fresh and vibrant. I wasn't a fan of the dressing and wish I had been given options like a balsamic rather than poppyseed or whatever it was, but that's neither here nor there...just get the lobster sandwich and you'll be a happy camper.Friends ordered pizza, tuna salad and beef tartar. Everyone seemed happy with their meals, so YAY. This is definitely a place to hang out for awhile and have drinks and good food while listening to some jazz.

This spot caught our eye, there was live music the building was two stories and there was an indoor outdoor and in between area. We asked for a table to enjoy the live jazz, ordered a bottle of white wine and the cheese platter. It was such a nice ambiance and the menu looked so good that I wish I was hungry enough to order a full meal. Will definitely return for dinner or brunch one day

Came back again after several years and the experience was just as fantastic! Great service, good food, and the ambience and music are just perfect!! The duck confit crepe that I tried this time was very good, but the crab cake was amazing (though a bit pricey for one- but worth it!)

C'est bon! Jardin Nelson was my stellar introduction to Montreal and I couldn't be more grateful for a singularly wonderful lunch experience.Jardin Nelson is located only a few minutes away from Old Port next to a bunch of tourist-friendly spaces. At first, I wanted to sit outside facing the cobblestoned walking area, but then I noticed the outside garden in the back and I had to go for it. It was absolutely stunning - the flowers were in full bloom, the trees cast a nice shade over the area, bees and birds buzzed around everywhere, and a live keyboardist and bassist kept us company with some beautiful Beatles cover songs. I was so pleased.The waitstaff was so unbelievably genial and friendly. The food was incredible, too - I had a diva crepe and a mojito with raspberries. Both were decently sized and excellently prepared. This place may err on the slightly more pricey side but I think it's worth it if you're looking for a meal that is the total package.

Is it a tourist trap? Probably. But at least the food is good. We were a big group (11) so I had the chance to try a lot of things.The pizzas. These are worth having. They a thin crust which I prefer and the different kind tastes good. Ask for their spicy oil. It goes really well on meat pizzas.The crepes are also good.The nachos, fried calamari and melting brie cheese on the other hand are not worth it. They taste quite ordinary.The drinks are also good. The Caribbean sangria was interesting but the basil lemonade was even betterBeing in an inside courtyard with live music also adds to the charm.Only advice is if you are coming here, come early. When we left there was a line outside.

The arrangements of mainstream pop songs passed off as "Jazz" at Jardin Nelson might more accurately be described as "Elevator Music" by a very kind critic. Any serious jazz student or professional studio musician might be more likely to describe the entertainment here as a horrific misappropriation of musical ability for commercial intents and purposes. The truth is, the music at this restaurant forgoes innovation and spontaneity, the hallmarks of jazz, in favor of lowest common denominator mass appeal. Nothing exemplifies this better than their cringe worthy rendition of the cantina song from Star Wars.Otherwise...The food also lacks innovation but is well prepared.The service is very good even at busy times.Best of all is the sangria.

Jardin Nelson use to be one of my favorite restaurent at the old Montreal. But after my last 2 visits, I was really disappointed with receptionist's terrible service. Today 3pm I visit this place for a business lunch, at that moment the restaurant was half empty, I request for a corner table which we feel comfortable but we were told that the table is keep for 4 potential clients ONLY, I reply that we are ready to order 4 persons drinks and foods but she still saying that "This is the best table of the restaurant and it can be only for 4 potential clients!" I do not understand because this is currently 3pm and the restaurent is half empty but she still insist that the table is ONLY for 4 potential clients. We were very disappointed but 20 minutes later 2 women were seat at that specific table ( I JUST don't understand, I believe this restaurent is Racism ASIAN peoples)  Too bad because the foods, the wines and our waitress was great!

Being close to the old port I've walked past this place many times. It's always packed and I've had the impression that it's packed with tourists. So I never even bothered taking a peek at their "garden". As summer is soon coming to end (yes it is), I was looking for a place that had live music, was outdoors, had vegetarian options and a selection of drinks and voila I thought of giving Jardin Nelson a try. They don't take reservations so we had to wait about 40min for the 4 of us. Parties of 2 were seated a lot faster than larger groups. But given the length of the line it went by pretty quickly and the hostesses were pleasant. I must say once we were seated in the garden the 40min wait was worth it! The live jazz was wonderful, the breeze, the flowers, the buildings that remained untouched yet you feel like you're in an outdoor sheltered place. And guess what if it rains you're pretty sheltered. We got to see these enormous umbrellas inflate and cover us up so quickly when the downpour started. All the rain water gets collected and recycled to water the plants they have on the walls. Pretty cool experience to see the umbrellas inflate and open up like ceilings above you. For how busy the night was, the service was pretty quick and the food was good. Nothing fancy, but you have a lot of options. They specialize in crepes and their pizzas, but the 4 of us tried other things, all of which were good. The salmon salad, salmon lasagna (apparently more like salmon gratin), tofu poke bowl (pretty good) and the eggplant al forno (came out piping hot!). Their sangrias are on the sweet side, not my thing. We went for their "least sweet" sangria which was the rose and peach sangria... can't imagine how sweet the other ones are. I'd definitely go back! It was a great evening with great ambiance, live music, plenty of options for food to satisfy everyone's palate (as well as for vegetarians)!
Delicious food and accommodating!  We ate outside and it was absolutely lovely.  I had a delicious mushroom and cheese crepe and the white sangria was lovely!!! Would totally recommend!!!

Loved this restaurant. Make sure you are seated In The garden courtyard . Brunch and live jazz what a winning combination! Our waitress Genevieve was top notch . Fast friendly service and the food was perfect . We will definitely be making the trip to Montreal again , just to spend time here in the garden

The host was very helpful and although they were very busy, he was very helpful and gave us the table that we were asking for. Another staff was very nice and super helpful as well.The food was very good, the only downfall that I can say, their chicken liver mouse looked like it's been seating in the fridge for a while, but still tasty.They had a band that was playing jazz. That was enjoyable as well. the atmosphere is very nice. we were seated in their patio area, which had a very nice natural light, and the temperature was very pleasant.I had raw beef tartar. It was my first time, so I cannot compare it to anything, however, I found it very fresh, and the presentation was amazing. Raw meat and raw quail egg sound very risky to eat. I had it, and I'm still perfectly healthy, so I can say that they're doing a great job on keeping their food fresh and healthy.

I really enjoy every moment at this Resturant, from the time  I walk in till I leave. Great ambience, staff and I enjoy the jazz music. It's a since of relaxation and at the same time romantic. I always order the Saumon frais / Fresh salmon- "Fresh Atlantic salmon, red pepper, snowpeas, julienned leeks, lime, black sesame seeds, vermicelli, flavoured with garlic, dill and coriander, served lukewarm". Very taste and salmon not over/under cook. I love the dessert menu and coffee menu, it's not overwhelming and they are also good.

It's my first time in Montreal and we came here after exploring the beautiful area for lunch! The ambiance was spectacular with live jazz music playing. Our server was friendly and sweet and told me about the vegetarian options. Food was incredibly delicious with great presentation! Overall, it was the perfect lunch that complemented our day perfectly! Definitely recommend this place!

user_city: Byward Market - Parliament Hill, Ottawa, Canada
user_review: The place was nice and the terrace is a really cool part of the restaurant especially for an evening dinner in the summer.

I visited Jardin Nelson last summer on Memorial Day weekend. I fell in love with the atmosphere, service, and food! Jazz music is sultry, it's like drinking a cup of hot chocolate on a cold winter's day. It's creamy, chocolatey, and warm like a hug from an old friend. I felt like Alice in Wonderland and I walked into a Secret Garden restaurant. Canadians truly are such kind and considerate people. Every waitress/waiter I encountered spoke French and English. Montreal was a little European adventure that was only five hours north of Boston. It was such a lovely experience, everyone must venture here !Bonus: In current time, the CAD is worth less than USD, so it's slightly cheaper for Americans when they visit!

Great place to spend dinner with your family or friends. The live jazz music is a great plus. I ordered the sliced pork sandwich and I have to say it was an amazing sandwich. My wife ordered the poke and was very happy with her choice. The waitresses was amazing, cordial, and always came around to fill our waters, and was always ready to fill our needs.

This restaurant is well-located in old Montreal. They have band who plays jazz music and a magnificent indoor garden, don't be fooled by their tiny entrance. However, the food was overpriced. I ordered the fried calamari for appetizer and a charcuterie pizza. The appetizer was amazing. The pizza however was just so-so. This restaurant doesn't take reservation and only allow under 10 people to sit at the same table. You might want to come earlier to grab the best spot.I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

In the middle of old Montreal with a lay-out of in between old structures, a large menu selection of delicately appointed meals, the restaurant's meals are fresh and the service pleasant. Service is somewhat slow, but at lunch time in a high tourist period, it is expected.

Amazing. Truly unique, relaxing ambiance. Great food, great service. We were stranded in Montreal unexpectedly for 2 days so we decided to see the town and experience some local tastes. We saw this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. On a trip where everything that could wrong, did, this was a welcome exception to a horrible trip. Thanks, Jardín Nelson!

We are just wondering what to eat for the dinner around the old pot of Montreal and find so many people waiting here. We decideed to have a try also and this is a good decision. We ordered the beaf and the crepe of chicken, both are delicious. The dessert is also very good very sweet and waiter is nice. There is band show inside, lovely night. I think i'll go back next time
Beautiful place for sangria, live jazz. and an outdoor dinner! Worth the wait! Food was very solid, nothing spectacular but the overall experience was amazing!

I came here while in town on my "mini-moon" and it was probably the most memorable dinner we had.  I wish I got the name of our server but he was a young man who made the whole experience better than ever.  He made two recommendations and we tried them both--- absolutely delicious and the ambiance on the patio is unmatched.

Live music, terrace, pretty flowers lights and decor, and fun drinks! The location is perfect by the port and has a great historic area. The lychee sangria is so light and tasty! I enjoyed listening to the live music and the fun laid back atmosphere. The heated covered terrace allows you to enjoy the space even if it's a chilly night with some drizzle. This was my second visit and I'm sure I'll be back.

My first meal in Montréal. This is just amazing. Live music, beautiful outdoor seating design, the service  is friendly and quick, and the food is just so delicious. The best of all is the price is very decent. I walked in expecting to pay "super fancy restaurant" price for this incredible experience. It ends up $100plus tip Canada dollar for 4 people.

Wonderful place to eat in the touristy area of Old Port/Old Montréal. After attending a terrific performance at Cirque du Soleil we were hungry for a late dinner and some cocktails. After walking around the area looking for a place we peeked into the back courtyard of Jardin Nelson and immediately knew we found our spot.The back courtyard at night is all lit up wonderfully with large umbrellas overhead, flowered plants and trees, along with a band and amazing singer crooning old standards. The setting is magical and we loved it. In fact, we went back on another night during our vacation to Montreal to enjoy it again. We ended up with the same waitress both times and she was just outstanding, and she remembered us too.Great service, fresh tasty food, good drinks, romantic ambiance, live music in the back courtyard - we loved it all. Highly recommended over many other spots to eat at in the area, and I feel it's even better to come here without children at night if looking for a more romantic and adult kind of dining experience.Just a terrific spot to sit outside and dine at when the weather is nice while being serenaded with the cool sounds of Sinatra, jazz greats, and other sweet sounds.

An excellent brunch spot that really does have the feel of a garden.Had the cheesecake filled crepe, with a side of bacon. It was rich and delicious. DCs enjoyed their crepes as well. The sweet local cola helped stave off the impending food coma.

I always love eating in beautiful restaurants and this restaurant is stunning indeed. It is open air restaurant with parasols and pergolas covering the entire area for shelter from the elements. The courtyard is covered with flower and trees in the most pleasing manner. It also multi-level which makes for interesting seating areas with various vantage points.Ok so we have established that it's a gorgeous restaurant, now what about the food and service?The wait during noon on a sunny Saturday was only 15 minutes.But the food really puts this place over the top. Often pretty restaurants get by "on their looks" and serve substandard food and have crappy service. The food was delicious, the service was friendly and the prices were surprisingly low for a high volume tourist area. Their menu in expansive and the place is known for their crepes.  We started with a pitcher of rosé and peaches sangria for $33 ... so refreshing on a hot summer day.For appetizers, I did the oven baked crab cake ($19) and it was great. No flimsy strands of crab here, it was CHUNKS OF CRAB all throughout without any filler! This would be enough as a small meal for someone who is not piggy (not me) since it also came with salad. For my entrée I got the pate chinois au candard ($21), which was their duck confit shepard's pie. Yelpers were raving about this dish and once again my people did not lead me astray. I savoured every bite and they did not skimp on the duck. My friend got the lobster mac & cheese ($29) which had huge chunks of lobster throughout.Overall another top restaurant in Montreal with a unique setting and great food.

Many rain refuge were sought today, but Jardin Nelson was most comforting.  We darted down the alley way entrance to courtyard, which under normal circumstances would have been a shady oasis.  Today, noooope.  The torrent of rain found every nook & cranny in their impressive over head canopy system.  There were however plenty of dry tables to be had and a local lunch special were on our minds.We were seated inside in the second level.  Nice table with good views of Place Jacques-Cariter.  Of course, the local brew had to be sampled first.  Nice selection of bottled locals and imports, but my eyes were drawn to the Boreale Blonde and Rousse.  Both very nice blends from Quebec.Lunch...well when in Rome, eat like a Roman, in this case, when in Montreal eat like a local.  Crepes galore!  Tough decision, but the Aiguillettes de canard confines, Duck breast "Aiguillettes," cheddar, mozzarella, cranberries and orange sauce folded into a savory crepe.  Oh my, simply fabulous.

Delicious food and great location! Right along the beautiful pier and feels like you're sitting outside (but restaurant is under a clear roof). The live band was also great. Overall, the service, food, and ambiance we're great. Would definitely recommend this place. Try the crepes and salmon poke bowl!

Had read up on this place and arranged to go,  there for the 1st night we were in Montreal. This restaurant was highly recommended and had a variety of selection of vegetarian food so we were excited. Definitely did not disappoint and would highly recommend it but make sure you make a reservation during high seasons because they do have long lines if just walking inFood - we ordered all vegetarian food - Small flatbread/pizza with roasted vegetables, Pastry with goat cheese and Jackfruit Poke bowl. All was very good though the pastry could do with a little more seasoning. Portions are adequate and the pizza and bowl were amazing in taste. We could not finish both items so took some of the flatbread home. Unfortunately we were too full to try the dessertService - exceptional and very friendly service provided by our waitress. Knowing we were vegetarians she made recommendations and even went extra steps to validate that any of the items did not have any animal products in sauce so kudos to her. Ambience - inside is amazing garden like atmosphere as they have plants and flowers all over plus they have free jazz music which was just the right level as it did not overpower your conversations but provided a nice backdrop of music. The place is huge and from the outside it does not look like a huge placeDefinitely go and try this place . You will enjoy the experience. They did not rush you at all (unlike restaurants in US that want to get you in and out in a hurry). We literally spend 2+ hours and had a very enjoyable meal before we walked over to see the fireworks

Ever just want to hear soothing music after a long day's work or just arriving in Montreal and you want to know where you can eat at the same time? Go down to the Old Port...Nestled in the heart of it you can eat at an outside terrace between four buildings. Nice decor garden like. The Good: they play live jazz 7 days a week. There's plenty of choices with their speciality crepes. We got La Forestière crêpe which is garlic, white wine, mushroom with asparagus and salmon on a bed of spinach rice vermicelli. Overall affordable.The Bad. Well you're at a garden so a lot of healthy choices. There are choices for those who may want to eat something like pasta or steak but- this ain't it. The Ugly: during supper hours lineups:( which can take at least 20-30 minutes. But if you don't mind waiting then it's worth it. Tip: don't do what we did and try to enter at St Paul ( because we saw the live jazz more from this side) go to St Jacques..this adds to your waiting time to get in. On a nice summer day get dessert elsewhere and coffee better choices outside.Stroll along the port and maybe take a ride on Montreal's ferris wheel, largest in Canada. Cost wise $$

I must say what a garden this is !! One thing that stood out is how this restaurants decor is as if you are walking into a total garden which has absolutely no ceilings.. All open space so when you look up you can see the skye!!The atmosphere is very exotic garden feel.. I came here with a special someone and we got a table very quickly. There was A LOT OF PEOPLE! It was packed!!! The service was poor.. We only ordered like 30 minutes when the waiter finally came to take down our order.The food definitely compensated for the poor service. I loved everything except the tuna ceviche. I found it super acidic and it was not a good balance. The fish tasted very bland. Omg i recommend the 2 different fish tartar woow that was delicious and the meat board was so good with the caramelized onions!! The shrimps were amazingggg they cleaned it up for us and had all the shells removed even the tail shells very impressed! I also ADORED THEIR PIÑA COLADA !!! Overall, service is not great but the food definitely compensated and would come back in a heartbeat!!! Definitely recommend this cool place 100% !!! yummmmmyy

I dined here 2 years ago with my husband, his brother and sister-in-law. They live in Montreal and it's their favorite restaurant. What a cool place. We sat outside under a beautiful patio.  Live music was playing and the food was excellent. Will go back here when we return to Montreal!

Came here with my family on our vacation! the ambiance of the restaurant is amazing as all seating is outdoors with flowers and lights surrounding you, and a live jazz band!  We ordered the seafood crepe, salmon lasagna, and baby back ribs. The baby back ribs are a must the maple syrup sauce is sweet and tasty and not like anything I've ever tried! The other dishes were delicious as well and the proportions were fulfilling. Our waiter was so sweet and attentive throughout the night. Love the overall feel and staff of this place and would recommend anyone in the old town area to try it!
I am very satisfied with my experience. The food was great, amazing service, lovely live music, and the atmosphere was romantic and beautiful. I loved the Diva crepes and the shrimp appetizer.

I think this place is great for drinks and some good music. The restaurant is packed to the gills, which takes away from the ambiance. I would suggest starting or ending your evening here, but skipping the place for your main meal.The beef tartare was really good (according to my husband), but my seafood crepe was both too bland and too rich at the same time. Our waiter was friendly, but overburdened with tables of impatient tourists and big families.

BEWARE - avoid sitting under the larger outdoor trees! Two separate instances of birds defecating onto our table, first on the menu while I was reading, the second time into one of our glasses of water. Very easily could have been distracted and not noticed. I am sure many people have unknowingly enjoyed an extra surprise with their meal. 5 stars because our server immediately moved our table without a hint of annoyance when we asked.

Wow! What a place. We were visiting Montreal and had an amazing experience at Jardin NelsonTo start with, when we got there, there was a big line up. The host told me that it would be around a 30 minute wait. Then he saw three little hungry kids with us and whispered something into the ears of another hostess. They didn't make the kids wait for food and put us at a table immediately. That was so nice of them. The ambience was amazing. On a beautiful summer night, the live band playing some jazz, the multi-level patio, the lighting, the smiles of the staff, made it all a lovely experience.The food was delicious. Starting from the ceviche, to the fondue, to the crepes to the pizza, to the beef tartare, everything was flavorful and heavenly.Even the pudding for dessert was freshly baked in the oven and was just wow!Of course not to mention the service at the table was excellent.I highly recommend this place to anyone. I would go there again next time I visit.And hey, it wasn't pricy at all. Very reasonably priced.

Just had lunch here.  Food was decent. I suggest the French Onion Soup, best thing we had. The red sangria was decent... a little sweet, but decent. Rest of food was pretty good but not life-changing.Service was slow... very slow. It took us 2 hours to get through a simple lunch.Also, they didn't take AMEX.  This is a pet peeve for me at this point. If you're a business who doesn't allow customers to pay with whatever their preferred form of payment is, I'm not coming back to give you my business...  who the heck doesn't take AMEX in a high tourist area these days???

This is a real hidden garden! Came here for lunch and the courtyard was beautiful and relaxing with live music. Totally recommend the brushetta, it was so delicious. I really felt I was transported to somewhere in Europe.

OMG!! This place is beautiful. Food is delicious. I think I found the city I would like to retire in. Old Montreal and Old Quebec is gorgeous. Old architecture, souvenirs, restaurants has unique but pricey.

My family of four stopped for lunch and decided to sit inside rather than the front porch and it was beautiful. Open air and plants every where. My wife and I had crepes. I had the rabbit saddle and my wife had the curry chicken, both were fantastic. The kids had a pizza which was also tasty. Their microbrewery beer is good and good service too.

Decided to eat here as was wandering around old Montréal and became hungry. I had the duck confit crepe which was delicious! I would recommend sitting in the back as there is a beautiful garden and live jazz. Eating here was a great experience and staff was really nice!

This place is stunning, but it's a bit of a tourist trap. I had the calamari and it was just okay. My fiancé loved his french onion soup. They charge us $70 Canadian dollars for 3 drinks, a soup and the calamari app. We ordered drinks on the rocks and they gave it to us in a tall cocktail glass that was not practical for a drink on the rocks. The Ice kept slapping my mouth whenever I'd tilt my head back to drink. The server was nice. The live band was great. I would return just for the ambiance, but I'd probably only get a small app and one drink.
Delicious food with a live jazz music and extraordinary ambience. Just felt expensive.

Wouldn't recommend this place...The food was not very good and the only reason I believe they are busy is because of their location which attracts a lot of unsuspecting tourists and the ambience/music. The crepe and the salmon poke were both terrible...Salmon Poke should not have vermicelli noodles!

This is a very beautiful place. The decor, the music and the ambiance are pretty great. The only thing is that i wasn't really impressed with the food. We had the nachos which were different from other restaurants. They make it with cranberry sauce which i really enjoyed but that's all. After that we shared a salad which was far from good. It a poke bowl with chicken. It has a weird taste. We had some fries too which were not so good. I think what made us enjoy Jardin Nelson was the ambiance and the company. Also they don't have beer pitchers. I would go back and try something else on their menu

Started off with blue Curaçao sangria which my wife really liked but i thought was too sweet.  Bread rolls were average at best. Bruschetta was really excellent almost tastes like a brioche. I had the spinach salad was was excellent, lots of fresh strawberries and a sweet maple dressingI had the salmon pizza which was good not excellent. Didn't love the crust. Salmon lasagna with bechemel sauce was excellent the best dish out we had. Service was ok, could have been more attentive. All this being said, it was a wonderful evening, as the patio here is outrageous.  It turned an average meal into an excellent meal, with the beautiful scenery, and the amazing weather we were blessed with. Definitely come for a nice evening on a beautiful day

If you are strolling down Rue Jacques Cartier you might overlook Jardín Nelson. Don't get distracted by lesser options. Look for the simple greenish awning with the name "Jardin Nelson". You can chose the patio but I recommend you dine in the garden. Excellent atmosphere with flowers, aromas and music. The jazz trio were fantastique. JN specializes in crepes. These are so perfect. Soft yet not soggy. They hold together without being tough and chewy. I had the veal and vegetables. Ita brilliant. If you want dessert get the Poudin Chomeur (Poor Man's Pudding). It's very much a traditional dessert of old Quebec. Our server was wonderful. Everyone here was top notch
Great food, super friendly wait staff, huge and relaxing back garden area that's covered with live music.

This was our first restaurant in Montreal and this was our first restaurant we went to. It did not disappoint. The food was delicious. I got the lobster roll and it was fantastic. While there was no kids menu, which seems to be common in this area, they did serve kids portions and all three of my children loved what they ordered. The maple ice cream is a must-have. It was a great way to start off our Montreal experience!

Loved sitting in the lush garden courtyard, retrofit into an old building site. It was great to hear a live jazz combo in that setting. It sometimes veered into cheesy cover song territory, but was really good when they stuck to actual jazz. The food was decent but a bit underwhelming - the salmon salad has no greens, just vermicelli noodles without discernible sauce, and though I liked my lobster salad more then my guy did, I did find that encasing it in dairy and fruit did nothing to celebrate the unique flavour of the magnificent animal that died for me. Service was really, really slow because they're so busy, and our upper patio table kept getting blasted with heat from the kitchen vent on the roof, but otherwise it was a terrific lunch experience in a cool spot.

I could not think of a better way to begin my weekend in Montreal. Imagine, I came directly from the airport, my Uber dropped me off right in front of City Hall and then I came to Jardine Nelson to dinner! Some call this a tourist trap but I disagree. We were a party of 5 and got seated fairly quickly. Service was nice, no pressure, although once it got busy I felt like they were a bit understaffed.The food! We ordered a chicken poke bowl, so delicious my husband practically licked the plate. Also ordered the curry chicken crepe, superb, the jardín crepe and added chicken, the veggie crepe, and a veggie pizza. The poke bowl and curry chicken crepe were my favorite.Drinks, local beer, long Island iced tea, caipirinha and bourbon bloody Mary. The bloody Mary with bourbon was a lovely surprise and I will never drink another Bloody Mary with vodka.Oh and our friend had a birthday and the dessert was classy and out of this work delicious. 10 out of 10 would go again even if I had to wait.The band was also excellent and the whole place is just beautiful. Would be a great date spot too.

If I could give this place a sixth star for its amazing atmosphere, I would!  This restaurant has a live jazz band every night, and that is only the tip of the amazing decor.  The restaurant has an outdoor concept, with second floor seating around the outside.  On this day, we ordered the French onion soup to start, and had the curry crepe and duck crepe for entrees.  The crepes were pretty good by themselves, and the soup was a perfect blend of cheese and bread, with quite a large portion.  We would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Old Montreal.

We were super happy with this restaurant. The atmosphere was relaxing with the live jazz, service was excellent and food was delicious. The flowers that make up the garden are beautiful. I'll definitely come back if I'm in Montreal again.

Get a table in the patio!!Come before the sunset and watch the restaurant transition from a beautiful enclosed intimate garden to jazz night with a live band!The prices are fair for old montreal the music and the experience! I like the pizza, the lobster salad ...but really it is all about the atmosphere and music here!!!

It's easy to see why this restaurant is rated so highly. Sitting in a garden, surrounded by flowers, eating a delicious crepe, and listening to live Jazz music, is a truly unique and surreal experience. The mechanized canopies look futuristic, and are able to shadow most of the courtyard. In the winter, there's heaters and plastic to cover the openings, at least in the front area. The food is reasonably priced, large portions, and quality ingredients. The service couldn't be any better.

You can't beat the ambience here. I specifically avoided dessert at the restaurant I ate dinner at, so that I could spend some time here in the short weekend I had in Montreal. (The dinner menu looked good but we had made reservations elsewhere already). We ordered the pouding chomeur, which is basically a maple syrup bread pudding. It was way too sweet, but I think that is the nature of the dessert itself and nothing bad by the restaurant.  I felt bad that we didn't order anything else (I was sugared out with that pouding) but since it was close to closing time, the server didn't give us the stink-eye. The live jazz music, the outdoor floral and fauna that gave the garden effect, the lighting ....it was the perfect ending to the night. Of my snapchats from all over Montreal, Jardin Nelson received the chat back of, "What is your life??". Sitting in the courtyard, I couldn't help but think, what is this life, indeed.

4.5/5 stars. A great place to look out for from mid-April onwards as they're solely a patio (front and back garden) restaurant and so open only for those coveted months. Situated smack downtown by the waterfront in Montreal meant we were in for a line up. They didn't take reservations either. But rest assured that it's worth the wait. The atmosphere was superb and there was live music serenading us in the lovely sunshine out at the back.We had a small pitcher of the rose peach sangria (~$22), which poured ~4 small glasses. It was certainly refreshing for the warm day but a little pricey in my opinion.Food wise I had most difficult time deciding on. Ended up with the duck confit crepe. It was DE.LI.CIOUS. The duck filling was so creamy, with the slightest hint of sweetness from the cranberries. The crepe was also very thin and crispy. Definitely would recommend it.

A wonderful place. I came here with two friends on a Sunday evening. Our waitress Melanie did an excellent job. She recommended a bottle of white wine we enjoyed very much. My friends ordered crepes, and I tried the vegetable pizza. The vegetables included everything from grilled zucchini to kalamata olives and grilled mushrooms. The evening was rather cold, but their outdoor patio was enclosed and heated. Overall, I highly recommend this place.

This place caught our attention due to the beautiful decor and live jazz music, but looks are definitely deceiving.My meal was by far the worst meal I had during my stay in Montreal and the worst meal I've had out in a very long time.I had the veggie burger and fries, which how can one mess that up? The fries were a bit cold , soggy and flavourless like they had been sitting out from the morning and attempted to be reheated. The burger looked good but had a very odd taste and strange after taste that was off putting. I was starving and ate it, but couldn't even finish it all. Even the guacamole had an odd really processed taste. Don't be fooled by the nice ambiance and DON'T eat here.

Good service, good food, great live music, and a really cute outdoor space. I came here for brunch last week and was pleasantly surprised by how spacious the back patio was, and how good the food was. We had the quatre fromages pizza which was, as you may have guessed, topped with 4 different types of cheeses and was absolutely delicious. The crust itself was not too thick, and the cheese was layered on and cooked perfectly, to make for a super filling and savory pizza you could share with one other person. We then had the zoodles, which was just zucchini noodles  with cheese on top and drizzled with a light sauce- a good compliment to the heavier pizza we had. For dessert, we had the crepe with nutella, strawberries, and was drizzled in another berry sauce. The crepe was delicious, and it was nice to see they did not skip out on the nutella. I also wanted to mention the AMAZING the maple syrup iced latte I had. It was actually not too sweet, which is what I was scared of, and it tasted SO GOOD.

Restaurant located on the old Port, it is a very nice place to eat, they have live music, don't know if all days, but Saturdays do. You need to go on the night, becAuse on day, the line forms for more than an hour. The food is good but not to do an hour line. Mainly for adults, they don't have children's menu.

We enjoyed it so much, we went back the next day! The first time we went for brunch and sat in the front patio. The second time we went for lunch and sat in the back patio - the live jazz music in the back was the perfect compliment to our meal. Great place to go for all ages. My highlights were the croque-Monsieur with smoked duck and the maple apple strudel crepe with ice cream.

Friend recommended this restaurant. I was skeptical that it would be a tourist trap as we a huge line outside. The host was extremely nice as he offered us to be seated immediately if we didn't mind being in the sun. We took the seat and later found out it was too hot. The server did not hesitate to move us to another table when it became available. We ordered crepes, beef tartar, salad and duck. All exceeded our expectations. We were there with kids and the servers were very understanding. We were never rushed and they even gave the kids some crayons. I'd definitely return to this restaurant whenever I make my way back to Old Montreal.

I've been here twice - once in 2013 and recently in 2017! Both times were great, however, this restaurant earns more praise for its atmosphere than its food. There's a live jazz band most days, beautiful outdoor seating, wondrous views, and fantastic service. The food is not memorable or legendary but it gets the job done. I ordered a baked duck dish, which I didn't think would be much like a Shephard's Pie but it was? Last time I ordered a salmon pizza that I didn't care much for. Appetizers here, for some reason, are really good. I ordered the brie fondue and the calamari and both were so tasty. Much more memorable than my main dish. Anyway, most of my friends ordered a crepe, and while I never had any of Jardin Nelson's crepes, I just think they look so weird. If you're American, you'll think: "Whoa, that crepe looks like a quesadilla."

Been here twice, the most recent time being almost three years ago. This restaurant never fails to "spark" joy for me, with an open-air patio that is good, no matter the weather, rain or shine. The band selection is excellent for live music. The food is not memorable, but this is not a negative comment; the food in Montreal is generally above-par versus Toronto for French cuisine and Jardin Nelson is simply another iteration of that high standard. I will come again, hopefully with my lovely lady.

Anyone who has been to or walked by Place Jacques Cartier in Mtl's Old port has probably seen the lineups outside Jardin Nelson. If you haven't already been then add it to your list of must to do things in Mtl!  Jardin Nelson is housed in an old heritage building which has a unique outdoor garden concept. It is beautifully maintained and adorned with flowers...the garden also has these majestic canopy umbrellas, rain or shine you will be fine! They also have live jazz acts which adds to creating such a relaxing and ambiance ! Service is always super friendly. Now for the food...although this resto is located in a highly touristic area, the food is actually very good! I tried their poke bowl which is a new item on the menu and truly enjoyed it!  Tasty and refreshing! I also had their cheesecake crepe which was delicious! They are known for their wonderful variety of crepes! Lots of choices!  They also have amazing cocktails..however if you care for a glass of Sangria...they only have it in a pitcher size. They only take groups of 10 max and you can't make reservations evenings and weekend nights. I went with a group of 10 on a Thursday evening at 6pm and was able to get a table. Delicious!

Went for lunch and even thus there was a lot of people the service was great the food awesome and we didn't wait very long. Forestière Crepe are delicious Try the homemade syrup in your drink it is delicious !!!

I think this is another case of a quaint location, and truly expertly, beautifully designed dining room, pulling wool over the eyes of customers into thinking the food is as good as the rest of their experience. Bruschetta: good!Lobster roll: bland. A mayonnaise roll.Fries: obviously not fried, but baked from frozen, and bland. Really bad.Beer: my savior.The wait staff was really great.
This place has an amazing atmosphere and food! Not to be missed! I could have gone here every night on our vacation!

This place is hit or miss, especially on busy days.  As we walked by here, there was a Long Saturday night line.  With a party of six, we were worried that we would even get a seat.  But within 15 minutes, the hostess spotted us and asked if we would mind eating indoors.To our relief we were seated fairly quickly on a very busy and crowded Saturday night in Old Town.  After ordering for waters, we waited; and waited and after 15 minutes, the waters arrived.  But they missed one of us.  And we waited; and waited; and waited.  15 minutes later, I got my water and we placed our order.  And waited for a long, long time. About an hour later 4 dishes arrived and 2 appetizers arrived.   The waiter assured us that two other dishes would arrive shortly (will describe the dishes in a minute).  After all the first delivered dishes were eaten, we waited; and waited; and 25 minutes later my dish arrived (beef tartar); with one person's dish still not ready, we felt finished the tartar and waited for the last dish.  And Waited; and waited.Finally my gf, was still waiting for the dish confronted the waiter who assured us the dish was on its way; and we waited; and waited for at least 10-15 more minutes. By the time it arrived we all wanted to leave.  She reluctantly ate her dish but by then, the damage had been done and the experience ruined.Based on our discussion with the waiter, there appeared to be a misunderstanding but come on, 2 1/2 hours before the last dish arrived?Come on management.  Educate your waiters and waitresses on more professional time management skills.  The waiter although polite and up front in explaining us what happened, he lacked true empathy and was oblivious to how pathetically late the last dish was.  Maybe clarify with your customers next time the approximate timing of when things are served?  I mean why would you feed 4 people immediately and have appetizers to two others and than have an hour and thirty minute delay for the 5th and 6th person's main course?  Made no sense at all to me.Let's talk about the dishes I sampled which I felt were hit or miss:1.  The Salmon Pizza topped with arugula : 2.5/5 Stars.  Too dry and not much love in it.  My 12 year old nephew loved it and gave it 5/5.
